search_results.title: Joe Louis - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: Joseph Louis Barrow (May 13, 1914  April 12, 1981), best known as Joe Louis and nicknamed the "Brown Bomber", was an American professional boxer who competed from 1934 to 1951. He reigned as the world heavyweight champion from 1937 to 1949, and is considered to be one of the greatest heavyweights of all time.
search_results.title: Joe Louis - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: Aug 8, 2016 ... Born in Alabama in 1914, Joe Louis became boxing's heavyweight champion with his defeat of James J. Braddock in 1937. Nicknamed the "Brown Bomber," his knockout of Germany's Max Schmeling in 1938 made him a national hero, and he established a record by retaining the championship for nearly 12 years.
